biological_subject.about: [Example: ensembl:ENSG00000127720 OR uniprot:Q13563] An array of Ensembl geneIDs or Uniprot protein IDs. Array = protein complex

properties.association_context: [Example: cttvexp:gene ] Choose_one: cttvexp:gene, cttvexp:gene_allele, cttvexp:gene_in_ld_region, cttvexp:gene_variant, cttvexp:gene_in_epigenetic_regulation_complex, cttvexp:transcript, cttvexp:transcript_isoform, cttvexp:protein, cttvexp:protein_complex_homopolymer, cttvexp:protein_complex_heteropolymer, cttvexp:protein_isoform, cttvexp:protein_signaling_pathway
associated_subjects: [Example: "uniprot:P05067", "uniprot:Q9HC29"] Array: If this association is also about other genes or proteins, please provide the additional Ensembl/Uniprot IDs as an array. Examples where you might need these are in gene_in_ld_region, gene_in_epigenetic_regulation_complex, protein_isoform, protein_pathway
properties.activity: [Example: cttvexp:up] Choose one: cttvexp:up, cttvexp:down or cttvexp:unknown
properties.key1: value1(string); these are specific to the type of evidence

provenance.date_asserted: Date the assertion was made expressed using javascript standard: 2014-09-11T10:59:43.511Z
provenance.is_associated: true; boolen value; for our first round, we will focus only on positive findings so just use 'true' for now

pubmed_refs: Array: Please provide the supporting pubmed IDs.

expert.statement: Can you describe the association in a few sentences?

database.id: Please provide a unique database name e.g. Uniprot/Reactome/GWAS_catalog

dbxref.id: if the evidence has been obtained from another database, please provide the name here
dbxref.url: The entry point in the dbxref database that cttv should point to

evidence_codes: [Example ["obo:ECO_0000356", "obo:ECO_0000236"]]. Array: Choose all the relevant evidence codes from the file cttv_evidence_codes.xlsx to support this evidence. If an appropriate code does not exist, please email a request to malone@ebi.ac.u, cc: samiul.x.hasan@gsk.com

urls.biojs: full address of the supporting biojs component if it exists

linkouts.nice_name: An array of nice_name&url tags; nice name for the URL
linkouts.url: URL entry point in your application

association_score.probability: If you can provide a probability from 0-1 for this association, please provide it here
association_score.p-value: If you can provide a p-value for this association, please provide it here

properties.key1: value1(string); these are specific to the type of evidence

biological_subject.about: e.g. ensembl geneID if this is a GWAS experiment

properties.key1: value1(string); these are specific to the type of evidence

association_score.probability: If you can provide a probability from 0-1 for this association, please provide it here
association_score.p-value: If you can provide a p-value for this association, please provide it here

biological_object.about: an intermediate biological resource e.g. a SNP rsID

biological_subject.about: the above intermediate biological resource (e.g. SNP rsID)

properties.key1: value1(string); these are specific to the type of evidence

association_score.probability: If you can provide a probability from 0-1 for this association, please provide it here
association_score.p-value: If you can provide a p-value for this association, please provide it here

biological_object.about: an intermediate EFO phenotype term e.g. 'high LDL levels'

biological_subject.about: the above intermediate EFO phenotype - high LDL levels

properties.key1: value1(string); these are specific to the type of evidence

association_score.probability: If you can provide a probability from 0-1 for this association, please provide it here
association_score.p-value: If you can provide a p-value for this association, please provide it here

biological_object.about: the EFO disease term for atherosclerosis
[Example: efo:EFO_0000637] A disease or a phenotype expressed using its EFO term. This can be an array if there is an outcome of multiple phenotypes

biosamples: [Example: "obo:UBERON_0000948", "obo:CL_0002553"] Array: affected tissues and cells expressed using their EFO terms
properties.key1: value1(string); these are specific to the type of evidence
